title.value: TEMPLATES: Characterization of a Merger in the Dusty Lensing SPT0418-47 System
title.justification: The exact title of the given research paper is provided at the beginning.
title.quote: TEMPLATES: Characterization of a Merger in the Dusty Lensing SPT0418-47 System

extractions.description: This paper presents JWST and ALMA results for the lensing system SPT0418-47, which includes a strongly-lensed, dusty star-forming galaxy at redshift z = 4.225 and an associated multiply-imaged companion. It investigates the stellar masses, star formation rates, and structural properties of the galaxies involved using various imaging and data processing techniques.

type.justification: The paper involves empirical observations and data analysis from JWST and ALMA to study the physical properties and interactions of galaxies in the SPT0418-47 system.
type.quote: We present JWST and ALMA results for the lensing system SPT0418−47...

name.justification: The research focuses on the study of galaxies and their properties, which is a central topic in astronomy.
name.quote: We present JWST and ALMA results for the lensing system SPT0418−47, which includes a stronglylensed, dusty star-forming galaxy at redshift z = 4.225 and an associated multiply-imaged companion.

name.justification: The study involves detailed physical and structural analysis of galaxies, which falls under the domain of astrophysics.
name.quote: In this paper we re-examine SPT0418−47 using JWST imaging and new ALMA observations.

name.justification: The model is explicitly used in the research for deriving stellar masses.
name.quote: We use both cigale and prospector to derive stellar masses.

is_contributed.justification: This model was not contributed by the paper itself but was used in the research for analysis purposes.
is_contributed.quote: We use both cigale and prospector to derive stellar masses.

is_executed.justification: The model was executed to perform analyses and derive results, as indicated by the usage in the research.
is_executed.quote: We use both cigale and prospector to derive stellar masses.

is_compared.justification: The results of cigale are compared with those of another model, prospector, to ensure accuracy and reliability.
is_compared.quote: The most significant discrepancy between the two codes is with the inferred stellar mass.

referenced_paper_title.justification: CIGALE is a well-known SED fitting model and the referenced paper is commonly known as "SED fitting with CIGALE".
referenced_paper_title.quote: Boquien, M., Burgarella, D., Roehlly, Y., et al. 2019, A&A, 622, A103, doi: 10.1051/0004-6361/201834156

name.justification: This model is used in the research for deriving stellar masses and other properties.
name.quote: We use both cigale and prospector to derive stellar masses.

is_contributed.justification: This model was used for analysis but was not developed in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: We use both cigale and prospector to derive stellar masses.

is_executed.justification: Prospector was executed as part of the analysis to derive results and compare them with other models.
is_executed.quote: We use both cigale and prospector to derive stellar masses.

is_compared.justification: Prospector's results are compared with those of cigale to ensure consistency and account for discrepancies.
is_compared.quote: The most significant discrepancy between the two codes is with the inferred stellar mass.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Prospector is another well-known SED fitting model and the referenced paper is commonly known as "The Prospector Alpha Two-Sigma (Prospector-α2σ)".
referenced_paper_title.quote: Johnson, B. D., Leja, J., Conroy, C., & Speagle, J. S. 2021, ApJS, 254, 22, doi: 10.3847/1538-4365/abef67

name.justification: The dataset concerns the lensing system SPT0418-47, which is extensively studied in the paper.
name.quote: We present JWST and ALMA results for the lensing system SPT0418−47, which includes a stronglylensed, dusty star-forming galaxy at redshift z = 4.225 and an associated multiply-imaged companion.

referenced_paper_title.justification: SPT0418−47 was originally discovered as a submillimeter source by the South Pole Telescope.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Originally discovered as a submillimeter source by the South Pole Telescope (Vieira et al. 2013), SPT0418−47 is known to have a high star formation rate...

name.justification: TEMPLATES is the source of JWST imaging data used in the analysis of the SPT0418-47 system.
name.quote: This data set provides robust, mutiwavelength detection of stellar light in both the main (SPT0418A) and companion (SPT0418B) galaxies, while the ALMA detection of [C II] emission...

aliases: Targeting Extremely Magnified Panchromatic Lensed Arcs and Their Extended Star Formation

referenced_paper_title.justification: TEMPLATES is part of the JWST Early Release Science program, where the acronym stands for Targeting Extremely Magnified Panchromatic Lensed Arcs and their Extended Star formation.
referenced_paper_title.quote: SPT0418−47 is one of four targets of the JWST Early Release Science (ERS) program Targeting Extremely Magnified Panchromatic Lensed Arcs and their Extended Star formation (TEMPLATES, ERS Program 1355, PI: Rigby; Co-PI: Vieira).

name.justification: This library was used for source plane reconstruction and lens modeling in the paper.
name.quote: We perform source plane reconstruction using lenstronomy (Birrer & Amara 2018; Birrer et al. 2021).

referenced_paper_title.value: lenstronomy: Multi-purpose gravitational lens modeling software package
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference paper is commonly known as "lenstronomy: Multi-purpose gravitational lens modeling software package" given the context of this study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Birrer, S., & Amara, A. 2018, Physics of the Dark Universe, 22, 189, doi: 10.1016/j.dark.2018.11.002
